analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi

translated: The reverse order of the dependent origination, the Tikatika version of the Paṭṭhāna, the Tikatika version of the Paṭṭhāna, the Kusaḷattika, the Dassanattika

original: Nakusalaṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā akusalo dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na kusalam na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā akusalaḥ dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: A wholesome phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as a cause condition, for an unwholesome phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing. (In brief.) As to the cause, there are three; … as to the unobscured, there are three.

original: Nakusalaṁ nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā akusalo bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nakusalaṁ nanevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nevadassanena🔽nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā
analyzed: na kusalam na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paccayā akusalaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na kusalam na neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ na iva dassanena  na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā
translated: A wholesome phenomenon that is not to be given up by development is a condition, as a cause condition, for an unwholesome phenomenon that is to be given up by development. (In brief.) As to the cause, there are three; … as to the unobscured, there are three.

A wholesome phenomenon that is not to be given up by either seeing or development is a condition, as a cause condition, for an indeterminate phenomenon that is not to be given up by either seeing or development. (In brief.) As to the cause, there are three; as to the dominant, there are three; … as to the unobscured, there are three.
